name: Super Lemon Haze
description: A sativa-dominant hybrid of Lemon Skunk and Super Silver Haze and two time Cannabis Cup winner from Green House Seeds. Super Lemon Haze is a kief-caked multi-colored wonder. As the name states this strain has real lemony characteristics. The smell is zesty, citrusy, and a little sweet. As for the taste, it's everything one would expect from the namesake; tart and sweet like lemonheads candy - not quite as sharp as one might expect. The effects are uniquely energetic and lively, may not be the best strain for those of us that are naturally wound-up tight.
descriptionPlain: A sativa-dominant hybrid of Lemon Skunk and Super Silver Haze and two time Cannabis Cup winner from Green House Seeds. Super Lemon Haze is a kief-caked multi-colored wonder. As the name states this strain has real lemony characteristics. The smell is zesty, citrusy, and a little sweet. As for the taste, it's everything one would expect from the namesake; tart and sweet like lemonheads candy - not quite as sharp as one might expect. The effects are uniquely energetic and lively, may not be the best strain for those of us that are naturally wound-up tight.

highlightedReviews.text:
Strain: Super Lemon Haze
Type: Sativa-dominant (80% Sativa)
Genetics: Lemon Skunk x Super Silver Haze
Notes: Spicy lemon smell with hazy, wispy nugs covered in hairs. Slow onset that starts with a light excitement/euphoria and a defined head high. Very focused and cerebral, giggly, and uplifted. Great for daytime and going out. Defined paranoia in certain situations, as well as heavy munchies. After the peak, a mild and energetic come down that lasts a long time. Great for depression and lethargy though not necessarily for anxiety or stress. 8/10

love this !!
to me.. it‚Äôs a mellow sweet taste and a happy energized high !! 
I had a day with some girlfriends at the beach and enjoyed this ALL DAY long with no heavy sleepy effects . very enjoyable.. I highly recommend for social anxieties of any sort and fir a high without sleepiness ‚úåüèæüíïüôèüèº

articles.title: What Are You Smoking? Episode 37: Cannabis History With David Bienenstock
articles.author: Leafly Podcasts
articles.text:
What Are You Smoking?¬†features Leafly experts Will Hyde and Bailey Rahn, as well as guests from all corners of the cannabis industry reviewing strains, test-firing products, offering up pro tips, and answering your toughest cannabis questions.
Leafly Podcast
What Are You Smoking?
Episode 37:¬†Cannabis History with David Bienenstock

In this episode:¬†
Veteran cannabis journalist and co-host of the podcast Great Moments in Weed History David Bienenstock visits the show to tell us what modern cannabis users should understand about the plant‚Äôs past.
We talk about stories and figures from cannabis history everyone should know, separating fact from fiction in cannabis history, and why the cannabis industry should work to change capitalism‚Äînot the other way around.
Want to learn more about the roots of the cannabis industry? You can read David Bienenstock‚Äôs work for Leafly, including his series on game-changing developments, here.

If you‚Äôve got questions for our hosts, guests you‚Äôd like to hear, or have anything else to say about the show, email us at whatareyousmoking@leafly.com. Want to listen to previous episodes of the show? Find them¬†here! And if you‚Äôre enjoying the show, we really appreciate you subscribing, rating, and reviewing it on iTunes or wherever you get your podcasts.
Strains & Products on This Episode:
The Big Sur Smoothie David is puffing on is a cross of Big Sur Holy Weed and Super Lemon Haze, while Bailey is enjoying a crop of Grape Ape. Will remains as dab-happy as ever, and is squishing up some Honey Bananas from House of Cultivar.
¬†





Meet Your Show Hosts
Bailey Rahn is an editor at Leafly specializing in cannabis strains and health. When she‚Äôs not at Leafly, you‚Äôll likely find her smoking her way up a mountain or playing dress-up with her cats.

Will Hyde is a subject matter expert, strain specialist, and digital producer at Leafly.¬†He spends his free time traveling and exploring creative outlets as a DJ, digital artist, and film producer.

About Our Music:
Music for ‚ÄúWhat Are You Smoking‚Äù is provided by Lusine. ‚ÄúTicking Hands‚Äù is from his album¬†Sensorimotor.¬†‚ÄúTwo Dots‚Äù is from¬†A Certain Distance.¬†For more about Lusine, check out Ghostly.com.

articles.title: Tips for Growing Super Lemon Haze Cannabis
articles.author: Leafly Staff
articles.text:
Ever wanted to grow your favorite strain? Leafly and¬†General Hydroponics¬†are teaming up on a series of grow guides that will equip you with all the tips and tricks you need to grow different strains successfully.

Strain Overview: The sativa-dominant Super Lemon Haze, bred by Green House Seeds, has won two Cannabis Cups, among other awards. A cross between Lemon Skunk and Super Silver Haze, Super Lemon Haze‚Äôs flavor embodies a sweet, tart lemon-zest aroma. Its effects mimic the sugar in the fruit that it tastes like, producing an energized, motivated feeling.
Grow Techniques: Green House Seeds recommends growing this strain with hydroponics. Let the roots take in lots of oxygen and give the plants plenty of space to promote vigorous growth in the buds.
Flowering Time: 10 weeks
Yield: Moderate to high
Grow Difficulty: Moderate
Climate: Ideally kept between 68-80 degrees Fahrenheit, Super Lemon Haze can handle higher humidity (45-55% RH) while flowering.
Indoor/Outdoor: Indoors is best, due to Super Lemon Haze‚Äôs need for close monitoring and warm temperatures. Also, its long flowering periods make it a difficult strain to finish in the fall if you are in a colder region.
Feeding: Avoid overfeeding, as this plant, though tall, is not dense and thus vulnerable to nutrient burn. When the plant is budding, however, increase its nutrients before the flush to help it finish.

articles.text:
Ever wanted to grow your favorite strain? Leafly and¬†General Hydroponics¬†are teaming up on a series of grow guides that will equip you with all the tips and tricks you need to grow different strains successfully.

Strain Overview: The sativa-dominant Super Lemon Haze, bred by Green House Seeds, has won two Cannabis Cups, among other awards. A cross between Lemon Skunk and Super Silver Haze, Super Lemon Haze‚Äôs flavor embodies a sweet, tart lemon-zest aroma.
